snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo attacked state education officials over a proposal that would give teachers more leeway to protest poor evaluations.
abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo attacks state education officials over proposal that would give teachers more leeway to protest poor evaluations; lawmakers have proposed a two-year moratorium on use of standardized test scores in evaluations, after complaints that teachers have had problems adapting to new curriculum standards known as Common Core.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo attacked state education officials over a proposal that would give teachers more leeway to protest poor evaluations.

headline.main: Cuomo Says Education Board’s Plan Dilutes Teacher Reviews
headline.print_headline: Cuomo Says Board’s Plan Dilutes Teacher Reviews
